importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the article indicates the most recent update on Sir David Attenborough's achievement as the oldest Daytime Emmy winner, highlighting a significant milestone in his career and in television history.
This date references when Dick Van Dyke previously held the record for the oldest Daytime Emmy winner, establishing the context of Sir David's record-breaking achievement.
The date when Sir David released his film 'Ocean' is mentioned as a key milestone in his career, emphasizing its significance in environmental advocacy and public awareness.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: Sir David Attenborough's career spans over 70 years, from the 1950s to 2025, illustrating his enduring influence in natural history programming and environmental education.

keyTakeAways: Sir David Attenborough, at 99 years old, became the oldest winner of a Daytime Emmy, surpassing the previous record held by Dick Van Dyke.
The documentary 'Secret Lives of Orangutans' won three Daytime Emmys, including outstanding daytime personality, outstanding music direction and composition, and outstanding directing team.
The show, which follows orangutans in Sumatra, Indonesia, is a non-fiction environmental documentary that highlights conservation issues.
Sir David has a long-standing reputation as a naturalist, broadcaster, and environmental advocate, with over 40 species named after him.
His film 'Ocean' is described as a pivotal work in addressing biodiversity and climate change, reflecting his ongoing commitment to environmental protection.

namedEntities.name: Sir David Attenborough
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A British naturalist, broadcaster, and environmental advocate, known globally for his work in natural history programming.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He is the subject of the article, having won the oldest Daytime Emmy ever awarded, breaking a record previously held by Dick Van Dyke.

namedEntities.name: Dick Van Dyke
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: An American actor and television personality, known for roles in classic TV series and films.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He previously held the record for the oldest Daytime Emmy winner at age 98, making his record the benchmark that Sir David surpassed.

namedEntities.name: Secret Lives of Orangutans
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A Netflix documentary film following orangutans in the jungles of Sumatra, Indonesia.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The documentary won three Daytime Emmys, including in the outstanding daytime personality category, and is central to the award announcement.

namedEntities.name: Netflix
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A global streaming platform known for original content and documentaries.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The documentary 'Secret Lives of Orangutans' is a Netflix original, placing it within the platform’s ecosystem and highlighting its role in global environmental storytelling.

namedEntities.name: Sumatra, Indonesia
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A region in Indonesia, home to the jungle habitat of the orangutans featured in the documentary.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: It provides the geographical and ecological context for the documentary's content and conservation message.

namedEntities.name: The Blue Planet
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A renowned natural history documentary series by Sir David Attenborough.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: It is one of his many award-winning works that exemplify his long-term impact on environmental awareness.

namedEntities.name: Life on Earth
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A famous natural history documentary series by Sir David Attenborough.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: It is cited as part of his extensive body of influential environmental programming.

namedEntities.name: The Private Life of Plants
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A well-known natural history documentary series by Sir David Attenborough.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: It contributes to the broader legacy of his work in natural history and public education.

namedEntities.name: Ocean
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A cinema-length film by Sir David Attenborough released earlier in 2025.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: It is described as a key environmental project, reflecting his ongoing mission to address climate change and biodiversity loss.

namedEntities.name: General Hospital
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A long-running daytime soap opera on television.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: It won the award for outstanding daytime drama series, showing the diversity of programming recognized at the Daytime Emmys.

namedEntities.name: Drew Barrymore
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: An actress and television presenter, known for her work in daytime television.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: She won the award for outstanding daytime talk series host, illustrating the breadth of the Daytime Emmy categories.

namedEntities.name: Daytime Emmys
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: An annual awards ceremony honoring excellence in daytime television programming.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The event is the context in which the awards were given, and where Sir David's record-breaking win occurred.

namedEntities.name: 52nd Annual Daytime Emmys
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: The specific edition of the Daytime Emmy Awards held on Friday, October 18, 2025.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: It marks the event where Sir David Attenborough made history as the oldest winner, and where multiple other awards were presented.

namedEntities.name: Pasadena, California
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: The location of the 52nd annual Daytime Emmys ceremony.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: It specifies the venue where the awards were presented, adding context to the global reach and cultural significance of the event.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Sir David Attenborough, at 99 years old, has become the oldest Daytime Emmy winner in history, winning in the outstanding daytime personality category for his documentary 'Secret Lives of Orangutans,' which also earned awards for music direction and directing. The film, which follows orangutans in Sumatra, Indonesia, is part of Attenborough’s long legacy of environmental storytelling, including acclaimed works like 'The Blue Planet' and 'Life on Earth.' His record-breaking win surpasses the previous record held by Dick Van Dyke at 98. The achievement underscores Attenborough’s enduring influence in both natural history broadcasting and environmental advocacy, especially as he continues to promote climate action through projects like his film 'Ocean.' The 52nd Annual Daytime Emmys, held in Pasadena, California, recognized a range of daytime television excellence, including wins for 'General Hospital' and Drew Barrymore.
title: Sir David Attenborough is oldest Daytime Emmy winner for Secret Lives of Orangutans
